SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.LevelChallenge

Class Scoreboard

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.LevelChallenge.Scoreboard
public class Scoreboard extends Object
The Scoreboard class manages the display and storage of the top 3 scores for the game. It loads scores from a file, saves updated scores, and handles the visual display of the scoreboard.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final javafx.scene.image.ImageView
    backgroundImage
    ImageView element for displaying the background image of the scoreboard.

    Rectangle for the black background behind the scoreboard.

    filename
    Path to the file where scores are saved.
    private final javafx.scene.text.Text
    scoreboardText
    Text element for displaying the scoreboard on the screen.
    private List<Integer>
    topScores
    List to store the top scores of the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • Scoreboard

      public Scoreboard(double xPosition, double yPosition)
      Constructor to initialize the Scoreboard with its position and load scores from file.
      Parameters:
      xPosition - The X position for placing the scoreboard (not currently used but could be for further customization).
      yPosition - The Y position for placing the scoreboard.

  • Method Details

    • loadScores

      private List<Integer> loadScores()
      Loads the scores from the file specified by filename.
      Returns:
      A list of integers representing the top scores.

    • saveScores

      private void saveScores()
      Saves the current top scores to the file specified by filename.

    • addScore

      public void addScore(int newScore)
      Adds a new score, updates the top 3 scores, and saves them to the file.
      Parameters:
      newScore - The new score to be added to the scoreboard.

    • updateScoreboardText

      private void updateScoreboardText()
      Updates the scoreboard text to display the current top 3 scores.

    • getScoreboardText

      private String getScoreboardText()
      Formats the top 3 scores as a string for display on the scoreboard.
      Returns:
      A string representing the formatted top 3 scores.

    • displayScoreboard

      public void displayScoreboard(javafx.scene.Group root)
      Displays the scoreboard on the specified root group.
      Parameters:
      root - The root group to which the scoreboard elements are added.

    • showScoreboard

      public void showScoreboard()
      Shows the scoreboard by making the black background and background image visible.

    • bringToFront

      public void bringToFront()
      Brings the scoreboard text to the front of the display.
